steps.text: Place a large non-stick or iron skillet on med-high heat.
Mix dry ingredients in a medium bowl: flour, brown sugar, salt, baking powder, cinnamon.
Add wet ingredients and stir until just mixed (do not over mix): butter, milk, egg. Add blueberries and mix gently until distributed evenly.
Lubricate skillet using a light coating of butter. Use a paper towel to remove excess, if necessary.

Ladel batter onto skillet to form round pancakes ensuring even distribution of blueberries for each one. Cook multiple small pancakes (~4 in. diameter) or one large pancake (~8 in.+ diameter) in skillet at a tine. Flip pancakes when browned on one side. Remove when other side is browned.
Preheat over to 425 deg. F.

Note: in order to maximize rising potential of biscuits, make every attempt to minimize touching mixture or dough with your hands, which will transfer body heat to the mixture. Place cubed butter in freezer for 15 minutes. Refrigerate buttermilk, pastry creamer (or fork), metal scraper, and biscuit cutter until ready for use.
In a large bowl, mix together dry ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, and salt.
Add frozen butter to dry mixture. Using a pastry creamer or folk, press/cream butter into mixture. Final blend should be crumbly and resemble corn meal.

Create a well in center of mixture and pour in buttermilk. Mix with a large spoon until well blended, mixture will become heavy and difficult to mix. Add additional buttermilk as necessary to ensure dough is completely moistened but not overly so.
Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and, using your floured hands, press dough until about 1 in. thick in a rough oval shape.
Using a metal scraper, scrape up dough and fold in half. Again using hands push down dough until about 1 in. thick. Do this 4 more times.

Using a floured biscuit cutter, cut out 5 - 6 biscuits and place on a non-stick cookie sheet. In order to maximize use of dough, you may have to scrape remainder and once again press down to 1 in. thick and cut new biscuits.
Place cookie sheet in center rack of over for 14 - 15 min. Bake until slightly brown as this is fine for wheat flour biscuits. Immediately remove from cookie sheet and serve warm!
Place a large non-stick or iron skillet on med-high heat.
Mix dry ingredients in a medium bowl: flour, brown sugar, salt, baking powder, baking soda.
Add wet ingredients and stir until just mixed (do not over mix): buttermilk, butter, vanilla extract, egg.
Lubricate skillet using a light coating of butter. Use a paper towel to remove excess, if necessary.

Ladel batter onto skillet to form round pancakes. Cook multiple small pancakes (~4 in. diameter) or one large pancake (~8 in.+ diameter) in skillet at a time. Flip pancakes when browned on one side. Remove when other side is browned.

ingredientsList.text: 1/2 cup vegetable oil or butter, melted

steps.text: Pre-heat waffle iron.
Beat eggs in medium bowl until fluffy. Add remaining ingredients and hand mix until just smooth.

Using a ladel, pour batter onto center of hot waffle iron. You will have to judge amount to pour based on surface size of waffle iron to make complete waffles, yet prevent excess batter from spilling out the sides.
When steam has reduced to a faint whisper and waffle attains a deep golden brown, remove from waffle iron carefully.

ingredientsList.text: 2 cups wing sauce (BBQ, garlic parmesan, teriyaki, etc.)

steps.text: Remove excess fat and skin from wings and pat dry using paper towels.
In a large bowl, season wings using dry rub. Add additional salt to taste. Refrigerate seasoned wings for at least an hour.
Add water to instapot and using a silicon basket or aluminum shelf (to raise wings above liquid), place wings in instapot. Seal pot and cook for 5 minutes on high setting.
Set oven to broil. Cover wings in desired sauce and place in a single layer on an aluminum foil lined baking sheet. Multiple sheets may be required to accommodate all wings.

Place wings under broiler for 4 minutes, keeping a watchful eye to prevent sauced wings from burning but yet become browned and crispy. Remove sheets from oven and turn wings over, place again under broiler for another 4 minutes.
Remove wings from sheets immediately and serve warm!

ingredientsList.text: 3 lb. pork shoulder (or boston butt), cut into 2 in. cubes

steps.text: Prepare pork by removing bone and excess fat (set aside). Cut meat into 2 in. cubes.
Season pork generously with salt and pepper and place in instapot along with with excess fat.

In a small bowl, create marinade by mixing the following together well: garlic, onions, cumin, cinnamon, bay leaves, soy sauce, and orange juice. Add to instapot, stir into meat, and let rest 20 minutes.
Add chicken stock to instapot. Seal instapot and cook on high for 30 minutes.
After fully releasing steam, remove meat from instapot and set aside. Ladel out ~1 cup of cooking liquid in to small bowl. Set oven broiler to high.

Place pork on a baking sheet in a single layer. Drizzle (fatty) cooking liquid over each piece of pork. Place under broiler for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and flip over pork pieces. Again drizzle with cooking liquid, return to oven, and broil for another 5 minutes.
Immediately remove pork from baking sheet and place in serving platter. Serve warm with tortillas and pico de gallo or salsa.

ingredientsList.text: carcass of a whole roasted chicken, meat removed

steps.text: Place all ingredients in pot. Ensure water covers chicken carcass by at least a 1/2 inch.

Seal instapot and set to high, cook time = 30 minutes. When done allow steam to vent completely, remove all large parts using a slotted spoon and discard. Use a fine mesh strainer, strain liquid into separate large bowl.
Add additional salt and pepper to taste. Allow stock to cool completely before freezing.

ingredientsList.text: 2 - 3 lb pork ribs, spare or baby back

steps.text: Trim excess fat from around ribs. If present, using a kitchen towel or pliers to remove membrane from back side of ribs. Alternative prep. is to slit membrane with sharp knife vertically down to rib meat in between bones. Remove excess moisture from ribs using paper towels. Season all surfaces of ribs liberally first using sea salt and then dry rub. Set aside and let rest for at least an hour covered at room temperature. You can also cover and refrigerate overnight.
Add water to instapot. Using an aluminum shelf or silicon support rack, please ribs vertically stacked in instapot to fit. Set instapot to high, cook time = 40 min.
Allow steam and pressure to fully vent before opening pot lid. Set oven to broil. Place ribs on aluminum foil lined baking sheet. Brush BBQ sauce onto all sides of ribs

Place ribs under broiler for 4 minutes, keeping a watchful eye to prevent sauced ribs from burning but yet become slightly browned. Remove sheet from oven and turn ribs over, place again under broiler for another 4 minutes.
Immediately remove from baking sheet and serve warm! Service tip: using a long sharp knife, slice/cut racks into individual ribs and place in covered ceramic containers for serving.
Using a ripe pineapple, prep. by removing rind and core and setting aside. Slice and cube 1/4 of the pineapple flesh.
Add corn and water to instapot. Seal lid, set to high, cook time = 30 min. Tip: corn sufficiently cooked when some kernels have noted cracking/splitting.
Slowly release steam and pressure and allow to fully vent before opening. Add cinnamon sticks, cloves, and pineapple rind/core. Seal lid, reset to high, cook time = 5 min.

Slowly release steam and pressure and allow to fully vent before opening. Using slotted spoon, remove all large pieces from pot and discard. Using a fine mesh strainer, strain liquid into a large bowl.
Add sugar to liquid and stir to dissolve. Add lime juice and stir. Allow liquid to cool to room temperature.
Add apples and pineapple to liquid. Ladel chicha into multiple pitchers ensuring even distribution of fruit. Serve over ice!
